article.headline: Chicago St. 103, N.C. Central 63
article.story: CHICAGO -- David Holston scored a game-high 23 points and Carl Montgomery added 21 as Chicago State routed North Carolina Central 103-63 on Saturday night. Mike Wilson and John Cantrell, who had nine rebounds, added 10 points apiece for Chicago State (11-9). Montgomery also had a game-high 10 assists for the Cougars. Chicago State dominated the boards, with 62 points in the paint, compared with just 20 by North Carolina Central (2-21). The Eagles came into Saturday's game with just two wins on the season and are 0-14 at home. The Cougars led 59-31 at the half. Chicago State made 17-of-33 field goal attempts, or 56 percent, compared with 11-of-34, or nearly 36 percent, for the Eagles. Philip Branch had 15 points and Vincent Davis added 13 for North Carolina Central.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
